image.altText: A woman with dark brown shoulder length hair and a red shirt speaks to the media.

props.synopsis: Federal Labor steps in to clarify its position on native forestry in Tasmania after the party's Bass candidate, Jess Teesdale, voiced support for an end to the practice in the state.

title.children: Labor reinforces it won't end Tasmania's native forest logging after candidate's comments

image.altText: Anti-pulp mill protesters outside a Hobart court

props.synopsis: Deals behind closed doors, tight time frames, a polarised public and attempts to go around planning processes — comparisons are being drawn between the Macquarie Point stadium and Gunns pulp mill processes.

title.children: Why the Macquarie Point stadium is drawing 'pulp mill' comparisons

image.altText: In a warehouse space, red lights, shaped like inverted crosses, hang from the ceiling, above candlelit tables, where people eat.

props.synopsis: The Tasmanian winter arts and music festival is back, with its first line-up under new artistic director Chris Twite.

title.children: Dark Mofo returns with creepy jazz clowns and a man slowly buried in sand

props.synopsis: Politicians are found frequently jetting over Bass Strait this federal election, with the state host to one of the most marginal electorates in the country. So how important will our vote be? Airlie Ward talks with ABC chief election analyst Antony Green.

title.children: TassieCast: Could Tasmania actually sway the federal election result?

image.altText: Three people at a barbecue with the words "We believe natural gas is essential..."

props.synopsis: The Coalition's internal pollster is helping orchestrate a campaign to boost public support for the gas industry ahead of the federal election in what has been described as "textbook astroturfing".

title.children: 'Textbook astroturfing': Coalition pollster working with gas campaign

image.altText: An aerial view of Tony Mokbel, handcuffed, being walked across a grey pavement.

props.synopsis: Victoria's Court of Appeal grants bail to crime figure Tony Mokbel, who will be released from custody for the first time in 18 years.

title.children: Bail granted to Victorian crime figure Tony Mokbel

image.altText: A slow shutter photograph showing a blurry market trading board at the Australia Securities Exchange.

props.synopsis: Fears of a recession in the US and big losses on Wall Street have flowed through to the ASX 200, which fell as much as 2 per cent in early trade. Follow the day's events and insights as they happen with our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: AustralianSuper hit by cyberattack, ASX plunges

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Federal government aware of cyber attacks on super funds
Australia's largest superannuation fund says some member accounts hacked
Household spending rises in February, for the fifth month running

image.altText: Dutton lowy institute

props.synopsis: Labor accuses Opposition Leader Peter Dutton of panicking over Donald Trump's trade tariffs.

title.children: Labor labels Dutton 'reckless' for seeking defence leverage to fight Trump tariffs

image.altText: Butcher holding a piece of steak.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's commerce secretary indicates Australia should not expect an exemption from tariffs even if it relaxes its restrictions on American beef imports.

title.children: Trump adviser suggests lifting US beef ban won't lead to tariff exemption

image.altText: Brown cows with white patches and ear tags run through a paddock on a hill overlooking coastline and fluffy clouds above.

props.synopsis: Australia is an exporting powerhouse, but the majority of the goods we sell overseas go to Asia.

title.children: Amid tariff panic, let's remember what Australia exports and who actually buys it

image.altText: Catherine McApline sitting in an office.

props.synopsis: The death of a man with disability in NDIS-supported housing last month sparks a police investigation and renewed calls for mandatory provider registration.

title.children: NDIS housing provider enters liquidation days after death of man

image.altText: Founder of Teach Us Consent  chanel contos speaking at the  National Press Club in Canberra on wednesday november 1

props.synopsis: There is bipartisan support for consent education to remain in the national curriculum, advocates are told.

title.children: Coalition would keep consent education in curriculum 'indoctrination' review

image.altText: Pete Hegseth addressing a meeting of allies.

props.synopsis: In a memorandum addressed to US Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth, the Inspector General's office said it would examine whether the use of Signal met Defense Department guidelines.

title.children: Pentagon watchdog to investigate Hegseth's use of Signal app

image.altText: Two people in winter jackets speaking in front of microphones outdoors in a snowy setting.

props.synopsis: During a visit to Greenland, Mette Frederiksen dismisses the Trump administration's desire to annex the semi-autonomous Danish territory.

title.children: Danish PM sends firm message to Trump on visit to Greenland

image.altText: The tower with a banner reads "lucky topping out".

props.synopsis: As Beijing silences mentions of the skyscraper building that collapsed in Bangkok, the Chinese company involved in the project faces mounting scrutiny in Thailand.

title.children: Beijing censors news of Chinese-built tower's collapse in Bangkok

image.altText: Three women cry outside as two of them embrace in an emotional hug

props.synopsis: The bodies of 15 Palestinian paramedics and emergency crews were uncovered in a mass grave last weekend, a week after Israeli forces opened fire on their convoy in southern Gaza

title.children: Israeli military denies 'execution' as it launches probe into medic killings

image.altText: two men look at each other

props.synopsis: Hungary's government has decided to withdraw from the International Criminal Court shortly after Israeli leader Benjamin Netanyahu, sought under an ICC arrest warrant, arrived in the country for a state visit.

title.children: Hungary withdraws from International Criminal Court during Netanyahu visit

image.altText: Mr Macron sits at a desk with EU flags in the backdrop

props.synopsis: The German government says Donald Trump "buckles under pressure" and would water down his trade war with the European Union if he's met by a unified response from the continent.

title.children: 'Brutal' and 'unfounded': Europe vows to retaliate against Trump's tariffs

image.altText: A highway patrol car blocking a road and police tape

props.synopsis: An investigation is underway after police shot a woman armed with a gun in Mulgrave this morning.

title.children: Armed woman shot by police in Melbourne's south-east

image.altText: A Polish soldier holding a machine gun stands by the reinforced barrier with barbed wire at the Polish-Belarusian border.

props.synopsis: As fears grow about the reliability of the United States as an ally, countries across the EU are scrambling to prepare for a possible war with Russia.

title.children: 'Good times are over': How the EU is preparing for possible war with Russia

image.altText: A man with ear-length blonde hair looks gormlessly at the camera while holding a white ice cream

props.synopsis: Mykhailo Polyakov had made two unsuccessful attempts to reach the home of the Sentinelese people before successfully reaching the restricted island.

title.children: American arrested after leaving can of Coke for uncontacted tribe

image.altText: A young father holding his baby daughter.

props.synopsis: Political commentators believe the battle for Brisbane will be a tight three-party contest, determined by how preferences fall.

title.children: Battle for Brisbane to be three-party race as Greens lose 'older millennials'

image.altText: An aerial view of the city of Darwin at sunset.

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory seat of Solomon has been held relatively safely by Labor for nearly a decade. But social, economic and political factors could see it in play this election.

title.children: The blip on Australia’s map that could help decide the election

image.altText: Two children in shallow floodwater with a dog.

props.synopsis: The sun is a small mercy for flood-devastated communities across outback Queensland. But as residents sink knee-deep during their muddy clean-up the stoicism starts to slip.

title.children: Floodwater to linger for weeks as sandflies swarm in outback Queensland

image.altText: A map of jupiter showing a wide band of hotter temperatures.

props.synopsis: Scientists say a vast region of unexpectedly high temperatures in Jupiter's upper atmosphere was caused by a massive wave of solar wind.

title.children: Source of Jupiter's mysterious 500-degree heat burst found

image.altText: A woman looking off the side with dark, curly hair and an earring.

props.synopsis: The NSW government has announced that for the first time in 20 years, no children in the state will be forced to live in high-cost emergency accommodation after the end of Alternative Care Arrangements.

title.children: Housing kids in 'traumatic' emergency accommodation ends in NSW

image.altText: A man with red hair and a red beard wearing a suit and a woman with black plaited hair and dark skin holding her chin in hand

props.synopsis: The investigation by the UK's Charity Commission comes a week after Prince Harry and other trustees resigned due to a dispute with Sentebale's chairwoman.

title.children: 'Blatant lies': Prince Harry welcomes UK watchdog probe into charity

image.altText: Donald trump standing in front of the american flag

props.synopsis: The US president says America has been looted and plundered for decades. Global trade is his enemy and his response? Big tariffs, or taxes, charged on goods imported to the United States, from another 34 percent on Chinese imports to 10 percent on everything sent from Australia. Here's what it means for us.

title.children: ABC News Daily: Will Trump's 'liberation day' lead to global recession?

image.altText: Spain celebrates with the Women's World Cup following their win in the 2023 final.

props.synopsis: FIFA president Gianni Infantino says the United States is on track to host the 2031 Women's World Cup, while the 2035 edition is expected to take place in the United Kingdom.

title.children: FIFA Women's World Cup set to go to US in 2031 and UK in 2035

image.altText: Gout Gout and Lachlan Kennedy hit the line in the 200m at the Maurie Plant Meet.

props.synopsis: Gout Gout has stolen most of the headlines, but around him is a burgeoning generation of sprint stars some experts believe could be Australia's greatest.

title.children: Beyond Gout Gout: The other young sprint stars

image.altText: A blurry mother and daughter hugging in the background, a plant is in focus in the foreground.

props.synopsis: The mother of a trans teenager has successfully taken the first step in legal action against Queensland Health's director-general over the state's freeze on puberty blockers.

title.children: Mother of trans teen takes legal action over Queensland's puberty blocker freeze

image.altText: US Senator Cory Booker delivers a marathon speech in a black suit and black tie

props.synopsis: Test yourself with this week's quiz.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: Dutton's dream home, a royal bully and a long speech

image.altText: An ilustration of a woman lying on a bed with her hands on her head and her eyes closed.

props.synopsis: For some women, perimenopause can mean a drop in libido, or painful sex. But experts say a robust sex life doesn't need to be forgotten as the body changes with age.

title.children: At 42, Ange was having the best sex of her life. Then her body turned against her
